result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javion Lamont Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Javion Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Javion Lamont Johnson.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense in in receipt of discovery and an offer. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Pretrial scheduling order, signed and filed. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp: 1-4-2023

Defendant Javion Lamont Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling appeared by video for Javion Lamont Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 17CF726. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Maldonado. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court by video, defendant Javion Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to court congestion and the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Javion Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway.  Defendant Javion Lamont Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
